pr_title: Replace Javascript string concatenation with i18n parameters - addresses #1858

timeline.message:
Replace js string concatenation with i18n parameters

refs #1858
Remove Javascript string concatentation and use jquery i18n()
instead so that translators have the needed context and
flexibility to be able to do a good job. Also remove code-based
plurals conditionalization and replace with i18n.
Update French translation so I can test non-English support

timeline.bodyText: This "» " character feels more like a replacement for an arrow symbol than being really part of the message, so I would leave it outside of i18n intuitively. Because this is just a part of the "Access Service API" message it would be nice if we could merge it with the string below (core-recon/service-api) so that these words can be reordered but I am not sure if it is doable without adding HTML to the messages (I am not sure what the risk/benefit balance should be here)

replies.bodyText:
I include the right quote character as a stop gap in case there are locales where the glyph is confusing or inappropriate. (I don't have any way to judge how likely that is.)
There is a whole category of "concatenation by juxtaposition" problems which are not addressed by this PR. That is the (unchecked) item 3 on the checklist in #1858.
The correct solution is probably to have a single phrase which is either all linked or which is followed by a linked "chain link" icon. The latter is probably more attractive visually. I can take a look at this one, but I'm intentionally not addressing this category as a whole.
